intro: Haukia, commonly known as the "buttercup of the forest," is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other showy wildflowers. The plant features delicate, yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-shaped structure, and its leaves are palmately divided. Haukia thrives in moist, shady environments, often found in forest understories. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for native pollinators.
